channel.title: Coding Help
channel.description: Is it possible for two persons to Code at the same time? if so can anybody give me info on it. Please Help and get at me ASap as my friends wants to help me too.

item.title: Coding Help
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“PeteVT, post:3, topic:440982”]Which one would you suggest?[/quote]well both have their benefits and solve different problems. pair programming generates good code because you have to program for readability and bugs can be spotted by your partner. collaborative programming with repositories and version control is good because it provides lots of features to aid with maintaining a project such as keeping backups and code history, as well as being able to revert to older versions and coordinate collaborations.

Read full topic

item.title: Coding Help
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“PeteVT, post:1, topic:440982”]Is it possible for two persons to Code at the same time? if so can anybody give me info on it. Please Help and get at me ASap as my friends wants to help me too.[/quote]what do you mean? live collaboration where you both edit the same file at the same time? there is software for pair-programming over the internet or perhaps you could just use teamviewer or some other desktop sharing tool.

if you mean sharing projects and collaborating there are lots of software for doing this, SVN and Git are the most popular. (some people use dropbox for it but they are fucking morons)

Read full topic
